00088 /*  You shouldn't use "using" directives in a header file, but the code gets
00089     nearly unreadable otherwise:
00090     typename std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> >::iterator i = _X.begin();
00091     And because I'm defining template classes here, code must be written in the
00092     header file anyway.
00093 */
00094 using VecMath::Vector;
00095 using std::vector;
00096 
00097 #include <iomanip>
00098 
00099 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::print() {
00100     std::cerr << _dimension << "-dimensional object: ";
00101     std::string separator = "";
00102     for(typename vector<Vector<D> >::iterator i = X().begin();
00103         i != X().end(); ++i){
00104         std::cerr << separator << *i;
00105         separator = ", ";
00106     }
00107     std::cerr << "\n";
00108 
00109 #   if 1
00110         std::cerr << "Surfaces: \n";
00111         for (unsigned i = 0; i < surface().size(); ++i) {
00112             std::cerr << std::setw(4) << i << " (";
00113             separator = "";
00114             for (uintvec1D::iterator j = surface()[i].begin();
00115                  j != surface()[i].end(); ++j) {
00116                 std::cerr << separator << std::setw(4) << *j;
00117                 separator = ", ";
00118             }
00119             std::cerr << ")\n";
00120         }
00121         std::cerr << "\n";
00122 #   endif
00123 
00124 }

00128 template <unsigned D, unsigned D_>
00129     std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D_> > project(const std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> > &x,
00130                                               double scrW, double camW) {
00131         if (D_ > D) {
00132             throw std::logic_error("Tried to project to a higher dimension");
00133         }
00134         if (D_ == D) {
00135             throw std::logic_error("Explicit specialization should be called");
00136         }
00137 
00138         throw NotYetImplementedException("template <unsigned D, unsigned D_>\n"
00139                 "        std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D_> > project(\n"
00140                 "            const std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> &x)");
00141         std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D_> > v;
00142         return v;
00143     }
00144 
00146 template <unsigned D>
00147     std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> > project(
00148         const std::vector<VecMath::Vector<D> > &x, double, double) {
00149         return x;
00150     }

00158 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00159                                                       unsigned v3, unsigned v4) {
00160     if (v1 >= X().size() || v2 >= X().size() ||
00161         v3 >= X().size() || v4 >= X().size()) {
00162         throw std::out_of_range("vertex_data<D>::addSurface(): index larger "
00163                                 "than size of vertex array");
00164     }
00165 
00166     uintvec1D tmp;
00167     tmp.push_back(v1); tmp.push_back(v2); tmp.push_back(v3); tmp.push_back(v4);
00168 
00169     if (!checkSurfaceExists(tmp)) surface().push_back(tmp);
00170 }
00171 
00177 template <unsigned D> void vertex_data<D>::addSurface(unsigned v1, unsigned v2,
00178                                                       unsigned v3) {
00179     if (v1 >= X().size() || v2 >= X().size() || v3 >= X().size()) {
00180         throw std::out_of_range("vertex_data<D>::addSurface(): index larger "
00181                                 "than size of vertex array");
00182     }
00183 
00184     uintvec1D tmp;
00185     tmp.push_back(v1); tmp.push_back(v2); tmp.push_back(v3);
00186     if (!checkSurfaceExists(tmp)) surface().push_back(tmp);
00187 }

00192 template <unsigned D> bool vertex_data<D>::checkSurfaceExists(const uintvec1D &newSurface) {
00193 
00194     for (unsigned i = 0; i < surface().size(); ++i) {
00195 
00197 
00198         vector<bool> found_equal_vertex(surface()[i].size());
00199 
00200         for (unsigned j = 0; j < surface()[i].size(); ++j) {
00201             found_equal_vertex[j] = false;
00202             for (unsigned k = 0; k < newSurface.size(); ++k) {
00203                 if (surface()[i][j] == newSurface[k]) {
00204                     found_equal_vertex[j] = true;
00205                 }
00206             }
00207         }
00208         bool surfaces_are_equal = true;
00209 
00219         for (unsigned i = 0; i < found_equal_vertex.size();
00220              surfaces_are_equal &= found_equal_vertex[i++]) ;
00221         if (surfaces_are_equal) return true;
00222     }
00223     return false;
00224 }
